item.title: Episode 2 – Language
item.description: A chapter titled Language and Communication, from the textbook, Cultural Anthropology 18th edition offers an extensive overview of linguistic anthropology and sociolinguistics. It begins by distinguishing human language from nonhuman primate call systems, emphasizing unique features like displacement and productivity, and discussing the capacity of apes to learn sign language
